description: Lists images associated with a site

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: The site owning the images

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The image type.  Must be PRODUCT, BANNER, or BANNER_BG

parameters.name: approvedOnly
parameters.description: boolean - if true only approved images [Default = true]

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page Number. Results only return 100 records at a time

description: Returns the XML Schema that describes the format of a ImageData object
Returns a list of order detail objects which match the given receipt.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: sku/itemNo of the line item. Used to identify individual purchase in multi-item cart purchase

description: This head request is used to identify if a particular order or a subscription is active, i.e. it has not been refunded, chargebacked or cancelled. It will return a 403 (Forbidden) if that's the case, or a 204 if the order is still active. Note that it will also return a 403 if the order is not found, or the user does not have access to that receipt.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: sku/itemNo of the line item. Used to identify individual purchase in multi-item cart purchase

description: In addition, head request on a rebill transaction will return the status of that particular  rebill, not of the original transaction which may be different. It is advisable to use head requests only on the parent transactions.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: sku/itemNo of the line item. Used to identify individual purchase in multi-item cart purchase

description: Allows a vendor to change shipping address of a physical recurring subscription.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Updated customer first name.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Updated customer last name.

parameters.name: address1
parameters.description: Updated address (line 1).

parameters.name: address2
parameters.description: Updated address (line 2).

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Updated city.

parameters.name: county
parameters.description: Updated county.

parameters.name: province
parameters.description: Updated state or province.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Updated country code.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Updated postal code or Zip.

description: *BETA* Allows a vendor to change (upgrade or downgrade) the product associated with a subscription.

parameters.name: oldSku
parameters.description: The SKU of the current product for the subscription.

parameters.name: newSku
parameters.description: The SKU of the new product for the subscription.

parameters.name: carryAffiliate
parameters.description: Determines if the affiliate from the original transaction is carried over to the new subscription.

parameters.name: applyProratedRefund
parameters.description: Determines if the prorated refund should be applied on the product change. This parameter will default to TRUE if not explicitly set

parameters.name: applyProratedRefund
parameters.description: Determines if the prorated refund should be applied on the product change. This parameter will default to TRUE if not explicitly set

parameters.name: nextRebillDate
parameters.description: Allows the vendor to change the date of the next rebill. Date Format is YYYY-MM-DD. Not passing in any value will set the next rebill date to the next day of product change

description: *BETA* Allows a vendor to extend a subscription by a given number of rebill periods

parameters.name: numPeriods
parameters.description: The number of periods to extend the subscription by

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: sku/itemNo of the line item. Used to identify individual purchase in multi-item cart purchase

description: *BETA* Allows a vendor to change the rebill date of a subscription

parameters.name: restartDate
parameters.description: The date when the subscription will be resumed in format yyyy-mm-dd

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: The item number of the subscription product that should be reinstated for the order

description: *BETA* Allows a vendor to restart a cancelled subscription

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: The item number of the subscription product that should be reinstated for the order

description: Returns all the upsell transactions for the given parent upsell transaction.
If the transaction does not exist, or the user does not have access to the transaction, or if there are no upsells for this transaction, a status code of 403 (No Content) will be returned.
Same as the list command, except that this one returns the count of the orders returned based on the search criteria.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The beginning date for the search (yyyy-mm-dd)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the search (yyyy-mm-dd)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of transactions to be returned. Supported types are [SALE / RFND / CGBK / FEE / BILL / TEST_SALE / TEST_BILL / TEST_RFND / TEST_FEE]. If not specified all types will be returned. If an invalid type is specified, no transactions will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: The vendor name. Supports wildcard searches using the '%' character. (Wildcards are converted to %25 after url encoding is done by the client)

parameters.name: affiliate
parameters.description: The affiliate name. Supports the word 'none' to search for transactions without affiliates, and wildcard searches using the '%' character. (Wilcards are converted to %25 after url encoding is done by the client)

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Customers last name. Supports wildcard searches using the '%' character. (Wildcards are converted to %25 after url encoding is done by the client)

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email of the customer. Supports wildcard searches using the '%' character. (Wildcards are converted to %25 after url encoding is done by the client)

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The TID (Tracking ID / Promo Code) to search on.  This will search both vendor and affiliate tracking codes and be returned in the promo field

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Role account was of transaction options are [VENDOR, AFFILIATE]

description: List orders for the authenticated user scoped to the search criteria. Only the first 100 orders will be returned. This method supports pagination, so if the second page of the next 100 items is required a request header 'Page' with value 2 will return them.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The beginning date for the search (yyyy-mm-dd).  If a startDate is specified, you must also specify an endDate.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the search (yyyy-mm-dd). If an endDate is specified, you must also specify a startDate.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of transactions to be returned. Supported types are [SALE / RFND / CGBK / FEE / BILL / TEST_SALE / TEST_BILL / TEST_RFND /TEST_FEE]. If not specified all types will be returned. If an invalid type is specified, no transactions will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: The vendor name. Supports wildcard searches using the '%' character. (Wildcards are converted to %25 after url encoding is done by the client)

parameters.name: affiliate
parameters.description: The affiliate name. Supports the word 'none' to search for transactions without affiliates, and wildcard searches using the '%' character. (Wilcards are converted to %25 after url encoding is done by the client)

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Customers last name. Supports wildcard searches using the '%' character. (Wildcards are converted to %25 after url encoding is done by the client)

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item number of the order

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email of the customer. Supports wildcard searches using the '%' character. (Wildcards are converted to %25 after url encoding is done by the client)

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The TID (Tracking ID / Promo Code) to search on.  This will search both vendor and affiliate tracking codes and be returned in the promo field

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Role account was of transaction options are [VENDOR, AFFILIATE]

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Customer's zip or postal code. Supports wildcard searches.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The transaction total amount

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page Number. Results only return 100 records at a time

Delete a product

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: The site owning product to be deleted

description: Gets a product

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: The site owning the product to be retrieved.

description: Saves a product with the passed in parameters

parameters.name: digital
parameters.description: product has digital component

parameters.name: physical
parameters.description: product has physical component

parameters.name: digitalRecurring
parameters.description: product has digital recurring component

parameters.name: physicalRecurring
parameters.description: product has physical recurring component

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: The categories for digital products.  At least one is required for a product with a digital component, multiple may be specified. Must be either EBOOK, SOFTWARE, GAMES, AUDIO, VIDEO, or MEMBER_SITE. Providing a category for a product without a digital component will result in an error.

parameters.name: skipConfirmationPage
parameters.description: Whether or not to skip confirmation page.  This parameter is role restricted.  If you do not have the role, it will not be honored.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: The site owning the product to be saved.

parameters.name: thankYouPage
parameters.description: The thank you page for desktops. Either thankYouPage or mobileThankYouPage is required

parameters.name: mobileThankYouPage
parameters.description: The thank you page for mobile devices.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency the product is sold in.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: The price for the product.  Or in the case of RECURRING or RECURRING_PHYSICAL products, the initial price.

parameters.name: rebillPrice
parameters.description: In the case of RECURRING or RECURRING_PHYSICAL (required) products the rebill price.

parameters.name: rebillCommission
parameters.description: In the case of RECURRING or RECURRING_PHYSICAL products the rebill commission.

parameters.name: trialPeriod
parameters.description: In the case of RECURRING or RECURRING_PHYSICAL (required) products the trial period.  Must  be either 0 or a whole number between 3 and 31.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description: In the case of RECURRING or RECURRING_PHYSICAL (required) products the rebill frequency. Must be either WEEKLY, BI_WEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, HALF_YEARLY or YEARLY

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: In the case of RECURRING or RECURRING_PHYSICAL (required) products the rebill duration.

parameters.name: shippingProfile
parameters.description: In the case of PHYSICAL or RECURRING_PHYSICAL products the name of the shipping profile

parameters.name: purchaseCommission
parameters.description: The commission rate for the product - if unspecified the sites commission rate will be used.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language of the product.  Must be either DE (German), EN (English), ES, (Spanish), FR (French), IT (Italian), or PT (Portuguese)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the product

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: In the case of PHYSICAL or RECURRING_PHYSICAL (required) the description of the product.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The id of the image associated to the product

parameters.name: pitchPage
parameters.description: The URL where you pitch your product. This might be the same as the HopLink Target URL. Either pitchPage or mobilePitchPage is required.

parameters.name: mobilePitchPage
parameters.description: The URL where you pitch your product to customers on mobile devices. This might be the same as the HopLink Target URL. Either pitchPage or mobilePitchPage is required.

parameters.name: saleRefundDaysLimit
parameters.description: The number days within which a sale can be refunded

parameters.name: rebillRefundDaysLimit
parameters.description: The number days within which a rebill can be refunded

parameters.name: deliveryMethod
parameters.description: The method of delivery.

parameters.name: deliverySpeed
parameters.description: The speed of delivery.

parameters.name: preRebillNotificationOverride
parameters.description: When set, Pre-rebill notificaitons will be sent when the frequency is greater than the required cycle.

parameters.name: preRebillNotificationLeadTime
parameters.description: The number of days before the rebill notification.  When enabled, a Pre-rebill notification will be sent to the number equal to the number of days indicated in the lead time and will apply to the rest of the subscription.

description: Lists all products

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: The site owning the products

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The product types to return.d  Must be either STANDARD or RECURRING.  Will return all types if not specified

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page Number. Results only return 100 records at a time

description: Returns the XML Schema that describes the format of a ProductData object
Return a list of all account nicknames which the current api user has read access.

The count service sums the quickstat sale, refund and chargeback amounts based on the search criteria. If no search conditions are set, it will return the sum of the values for the last 45 days based on all the accounts linked to the API keys. The count service is similar to the list method except for the fact that it presents the user with one total of the dates specified the search criteria instead of listing each day's quickstat values individually. Note that the quickStatDate in the returned data will be null.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The beginning date for the search (yyyy-mm-dd). Defaults to 45 days from today if not specified.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the search (yyyy-mm-dd). Defaults to today if not specified

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The nickName of the account. Defaults to all  accounts if not specified.

description: Return the quickstats for the api user, based on the search criteria. If no search conditions are set, it will return the quickstats for all the accounts for the API user for the last 45 days

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The beginning date for the search (yyyy-mm-dd). Defaults to 45 days from today if not specified.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the search (yyyy-mm-dd). Defaults to today if not specified

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The nickName of the account. Defaults to all  accounts if not specified.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page Number. Results only return 100 records at a time

description: Returns the XML Schema that describes the format of the retrieved data for the accounts.
Returns a count of physical goods orders matching the shipping criteria.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can be 'shipped', 'notshipped' or 'all' - to find related orders.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Return orders within the last n days. If start and end date are specified, they will take precedence over this value. If neither days, startDate or endDate is specified, it will default to last 30 days or orders.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Instead of using the days parameter, a user can specify a date range (yyyy-mm-dd). This is the start date

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Instead of using the days parameter, a user can specify a date range (yyyy-mm-dd). This is the endDate

parameters.name: receipt
parameters.description: Search the physical good order by receipt. If this parameter is specified, the other search parameters will be ignored.

description: Returns the XML Schema that describes the format of the retrieved data when the Shipnotice Service API calls are made.
Find a ticket by its ID. Will return the ticket with the given ID back. If the ticket does not exist, or the user is not authorized to view the ticket - a status code of 403 will be returned.

Allows the user to close a ticket, comment on a ticket, change type of a ticket, or reopen the ticket. Will return a status code 200 if the action is successful, a 403 if user is not allowed to act on the ticket or the ticket does not exist. Upon success, this will return the ticket data. Please note that closing of a ticket manually means that the ticket is cancelled. So for example closing of an open refund ticket will cancel the refund request. If the action is not specified, the assumption is that the user is trying to comment on the ticket. Also note that reopening is only supported for closed tickets and will return a 400 status code otherwise.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to be taken. Supported actions are 'change', 'close' and 'reopen'.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: The comments that go along with the action, or comments on the ticket. Comments are required when reopening a ticket.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: If changing the type of the ticket, this will be one of rfnd, cncl, or tech. Note: Partial refunds are not allowed when changing to a rfnd ticket type. Tickets changed to rfnd will be full refunds.

description: Acknowledges return of physical item from customer, allowing refund of transaction to complete.  This call will return a status code of 204 if successful.  The body of the response will be empty in this case.  A 403 (Forbidden) status code will be return if access is denied.  A 400 (Bad Request) will be returned if the ticket isn't found or the ticket is not for a physical purchase.
Create a ticket with the passed in parameters. Will return the created ticket if it's successful.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: sku/itemNo of the line item. Used to identify individual purchase in multi-item cart purchase

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the ticket. Must be either 'rfnd', 'cncl' or 'tech'. For 'rfnd' the parameter refundType must also be specified. If the receipt is for a non-recurring product, either 'rfnd' or 'cncl' will automatically refund that sale.  For any receipt of a recurring product, a 'rfnd' will refund that receipt AND cancel any future billing, while a 'cncl' will only cancel future billing without issuing any refunds.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: The comments associated with creating a ticket.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason associated with the ticket. A ticket reason should be one of the following based on type: CNCLticket.type.cancel.1 (I did not receive additional value for the recurring payments).ticket.type.cancel.2 (I was not satisfied with the subscription / Subscription did not meet expectations) ticket.type.cancel.3 (I was unable to get support from the vendor) ticket.type.cancel.4 (Product was not compatible with my computer) ticket.type.cancel.5 (I am unable to afford continuing payments for this subscription) ticket.type.cancel.6 (I did not realize that I accepted the terms for continuing payments) ticket.type.cancel.7 (Other) ticket.type.cancel.not.mobile (Product was not compatible with my mobile device.) RFNDticket.type.refund.1 (I never received my product) ticket.type.refund.2 (I was not satisfied with the product. / Product did not meet expectations) ticket.type.refund.3 (Product was not compatible with my computer) ticket.type.refund.4 (I was unable to get technical support) ticket.type.refund.5 (I did not authorize the purchase) ticket.type.refund.6 (I do not recognize the purchase) ticket.type.refund.7 (Duplicate purchase. / Or already purchased product previously) ticket.type.refund.returned (Product returned) ticket.type.refund.8 (Other) ticket.type.refund.not.mobile (Product was not compatible with my mobile device.) TECHticket.type.tech_support.1 (I am unable to log in.) ticket.type.tech_support.2 (I had problems downloading the product.) ticket.type.tech_support.3 (I never received a valid registration code, please send a valid code.) ticket.type.tech_support.4 (I can't get the product to work.) ticket.type.tech_support.9 (Other)ticket.type.tech_support.10 (I never received my product.)

parameters.name: refundType
parameters.description: The type of refund. Supported values include 'FULL', 'PARTIAL_PERCENT', 'PARTIAL_AMOUNT' (case sensitive). For 'PARTIAL_PERCENT' and 'PARTIAL_AMOUNT' the parameter refundAmount must be specified.  Additionally the vendor associated with the transaction must be enabled for partial refunds in order to use both 'PARTIAL_PERCENT' and 'PARTIAL_AMOUNT', if vendor is not enabled and one of the partial options is specified a 403 will be returned.

parameters.name: refundAmount
parameters.description: Specified for partial refunds indicating the amount of the transaction to be refunded. For 'PARTIAL_PERCENT' this must be a number between 1 and 80, with no more than two digits of precision - for example 50.00. For 'PARTIAL_AMOUNT' this is the amount to refund in the currency the customer used during the purchase. The resource /1.3/tickets/refundAmounts may be used to retrieve what amounts in the customers currency convert to.

parameters.name: retainSubscription
parameters.description: Specifies if the subscription should be retained after the refund has been processed

description: Counts the tickets matching the search criteria.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the ticket. Must be either 'rfnd' / 'cncl' or 'tech'

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the ticket. Can be 'open', 'reopened' or 'closed'

parameters.name: receipt
parameters.description: Counts a ticket by a given receipt. Will return the ticket(s) associated with the transaction. If the receipt is a subscription, all tickets with associated with each rebill of that subscription will be counted.

description: Searches for tickets matching the search criteria. Will return a list of ticket data objects with a status code of 200. If more than 100 results are returned, it will return a status code of 206 [Partial Content]. Users can then use the 'Page' header to determine the page needed.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the ticket. Must be either 'rfnd' / 'cncl' or 'tech'

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the ticket. Can be 'open', 'reopened' or 'closed'

parameters.name: receipt
parameters.description: Find a ticket by a given receipt. Will return the ticket(s) associated with the transaction. If the receipt is a subscription, all tickets with associated with each rebill of that subscription will be returned.  Must be 4 or more characters in length, not counting the wildcard character ('%').  May not start with the wildcard character.

parameters.name: createDateFrom
parameters.description: The start of the createDate range to filter tickets by. If you provide a 'createDateFrom', you must also provide a 'createDateTo' to complete the date range. The range cannot be more than 7 days in length. Dates must be in the format 'yyyy-mm-dd', i.e '2011-12-31' for December 31st, 2011.

parameters.name: createDateTo
parameters.description: The end of the createDate range to filter tickets by. If you provide a 'createDateTo', you must also provide a 'createDateFrom' to complete the date range. The range cannot be more than 7 days in length. Dates must be in the format 'yyyy-mm-dd', i.e '2011-12-31' for December 31st, 2011.

parameters.name: updateDateFrom
parameters.description: The start of the updateDate range to filter tickets by. If you provide a 'updateDateFrom', you must also provide a 'updateDateTo' to complete the date range. The range cannot be more than 7 days in length. Dates must be in the format 'yyyy-mm-dd', i.e '2011-12-31' for December 31st, 2011.

parameters.name: updateDateTo
parameters.description: The end of the updateDate range to filter tickets by. If you provide a 'updateDateTo', you must also provide a 'updateDateFrom' to complete the date range. The range cannot be more than 7 days in length. Dates must be in the format 'yyyy-mm-dd', i.e '2011-12-31' for December 31st, 2011.

parameters.name: closeDateFrom
parameters.description: The start of the closeDate range to filter tickets by. If you provide a 'closeDateFrom', you must also provide a 'closeDateTo' to complete the date range. The range cannot be more than 7 days in length. Dates must be in the format 'yyyy-mm-dd', i.e '2011-12-31' for December 31st, 2011.

parameters.name: closeDateTo
parameters.description: The end of the closeDate range to filter tickets by. If you provide a 'closeDateTo', you must also provide a 'closeDateFrom' to complete the date range. The range cannot be more than 7 days in length. Dates must be in the format 'yyyy-mm-dd', i.e '2011-12-31' for December 31st, 2011.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page Number. Results only return 100 records at a time

description: Returns amounts that would be refunded for a given refund type & value.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: line item sku/itemNo

parameters.name: refundType
parameters.description: The type of refund. Supported values include 'FULL', 'PARTIAL_PERCENT', 'PARTIAL_AMOUNT' (case sensitive). For 'PARTIAL_PERCENT' and 'PARTIAL_AMOUNT' the parameter refundAmount must be specified. Additionally the vendor associated with the transaction must be enabled for partial refunds in order to use both 'PARTIAL_PERCENT' and 'PARTIAL_AMOUNT', if vendor is not enabled and one of the partial options is specified a 403 will be returned.

parameters.name: refundAmount
parameters.description: Specified for partial refunds indicating the amount of the transaction to be refunded. For 'PARTIAL_PERCENT' this must be a number between 1 and 80, with no more than two digits of precision - for example 50.00. For 'PARTIAL_AMOUNT' this is the amount to refund in the currency the customer used during the purchase.

description: Returns the XML Schema that describes the format of a TicketData object
